How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • App Engine Studio – for custom tender submission, review, and approval workflows

  • Integrated Risk Management (IRM) – for automated compliance checks, vendor risk scoring, and audit readiness

  • Customer Service Management (CSM) – for managing supplier inquiries, document uploads, and case tracking

  • Flow Designer – to orchestrate bid approvals, conflict-of-interest verifications, and award notifications

  • Performance Analytics – to visualize procurement KPIs (e.g., tender cycle time, supplier participation, fraud alerts)

  • IntegrationHub – for connecting with external e-procurement, ERP, or payment systems

  • UI Builder – to design intuitive dashboards for procurement officers, auditors, and public transparency portals

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Vendor and business registry API to validate supplier identities and check for related entities

  • ERP or financial system integration for payment tracking and budget linkage

  • Email or SMS gateway for bidder notifications and updates

  •  AI or anomaly-detection API for advanced fraud pattern recognition

  • Document management integration for uploading RFPs, contracts, and certificates securely

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Integrating diverse government legacy procurement systems

  • Ensuring data privacy and integrity for sensitive financial transactions

  • Encouraging supplier adoption of a new digital workflow

  • Maintaining audit transparency while protecting confidential bid information

  • Aligning procurement policies and approval hierarchies across ministries
